titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 28 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 28
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the 1826 term of court, specifically the Saturday October 28 session. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: October and November
Saturday 28th
div1.p: Court met agreeable to adjournment Present John Martin, James Brown, Walter S. Adair & J. Daniel

Charles R. Hicks Ptf
vs
James Brown
William Williams
Jenny Williams Dfts
Slander for the words of robbery or stealing

The Court decides that the charges alledged against the plaintiff for the above offences, has not been proven, and that there is nothing porporting in the instructions, given by Charles R. Hicks, to a certain Company of men appertaining to theft or robbery and that the plaintiff is honorably acquited of any such charges
J Martin C. S. C

Cherokee Nation
vs
Edward Crittenton Talaskee

Michael Heldebrand Ptf
vs
Sleeping Rabbit & son Dft
